intro: Odonia incana, commonly known as the silverleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, hair-like structures called trichomes. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Odonia incana is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it an interesting subject for botanical study and ecological research.
